intro: Ardisia crenata f. leucocarpa, commonly known as the white-fruited beautyberry, is a flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is a compact shrub characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are a striking contrast to its foliage. It is native to the southeastern United States and thrives in partial shade with well-drained soil. This ornamental plant is valued for its attractive foliage and unique fruiting display.
